result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amos J Luckett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amos J Luckett in court.  Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Amos J Luckett.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date be set. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Amos J Luckett in court.  Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Amos J Luckett.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pretrial Conference.  Defense has not received the digital discovery from the State as previously ordered by the Court.  Defense motion to dismiss heard. The Court takes the motion under advisement, and issues the following sanction to the State: Any digital discovery not turned over is suppressed until further order of this Court.  The court ORDERS the State to turn over all digital discovery by 5:00 pm today, 9/29/2022.  Case adjourned to Br. 9. Scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amos J Luckett in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for Attorney Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Pretrial Conference.  Defense has received partial discovery and an offer from the State.  Court sets 8/26/2022 deadline for the State to turnover all digital discovery to the Defense.  Court sets matter for adjourned Pretrial conference. Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amos J Luckett in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 07/08/2022 as the deadline for the State to turnover all discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports to the defense. Court sets 08/10/2022 as the deadline for filing any motions or change of plea forms.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Amos J Luckett in court with Attorney Angel L Johnson.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amos J Luckett in court.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patrick Franken.  Attorney Thomas Reed appeared on behalf of Public Defender's Office, via zoom.  Discussion held on the record.  Attorney Angel Johnson appeared in court and agreed to represent defendant.  Court ordered this matter adjourned for preliminary hearing.  mn  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amos J Luckett in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amos J Luckett in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amos J Luckett appeared by video means.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amos J Luckett in court in person.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Amos J Luckett
Current: 2801 W Custer Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 02-09-2022)
Prior: 3261 North 8th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No driving without a valid license and state required insurance.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (2-11-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Amos J Luckett in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/9/22 @ 2p
